conclusion: Determine the minimum area of paper required to cover each face of the cube so the bubble is not visible.
Understanding the concept of total internal reflection and the critical angle.
The refractive index of the glass brick is n = 1.5.
Calculate the critical angle using sin(θc) = 1/n.
The bubble is at the center of the cube.
Cover the area on each face where light rays would exit the cube without total internal reflection.
The critical angle defines the boundary of the area to be covered.
Light rays form a circle on each face of the cube.
Find the radius r of the circle using r = (a/2) tan(θc).
Calculate the area A of the circle: A = πr² = π(a/√5)² = πa²/5.
The minimum area of each piece of paper required is πa²/5.
